text:
At present, the BSF and JSR223 test elements recreate the interpreter for each invocation.

[Whereas the BeanShell elements save the interpreter between invocations]

This makes it difficult to retain context across invocations.

It would be useful to be able to share the interpreter.

There are several possibilities:

1) save the interpreter in the test element instance (as for BeanShell)
This would reuse the interpreter across test loops, but not between different test elements (sampler and assertion would use different interpreters).

2) save the interpreter in a static threadLocal field
This would allow sharing across all test elements of the same type or potentially across all test elements, depending where the field was defined.
